messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Change the topic in the subject line	(was re: Digest...
messages.msgSnippet: ... And what should have followed that ultimately puzzling note by Nancy was something that was almost exactly like: ~~~ Don t forget! If you change the topic,
messages.messageBody:
on 8/12/02 1:42 AM, Dnowens@... at Dnowens@... wrote:

> From the bottom of ALL our posts.

And what should have followed that ultimately puzzling note by Nancy was
something that was almost exactly like:

~~~ Don't forget! If you change the topic, change the subject line! ~~~

but she didn't realize I removed it a bit ago since I suspect that though
people may have seen it on occasion, it didn't really register.

There's also a every-2-week note that automatically posts about changing the
subject line. I chucked that a couple of days ago too because I personally
found it annoying intrusive to have it pop up with no context. It just had
an impersonal feel to it.

Did either of them ever make someone remember to change the subject line?
Let me know and I'll put one or both back.

I think the most effective way is for someone to reach their annoyance level
and just remind people. That at least works for a couple of days. ;-)

Joyce
Unschooling-dotcom moderator

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Change the topic in the subject line (was re: Digest...

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/11/02 9:55:38 PM Central Daylight Time,
dawnwells@... writes:


> Joyce,
>
> In the group I own, we have this little reminder at the bottom. Can't
> say it was my idea though I swiped it from some where...
>
> >
> >
> > To unsubscribe send a blank email to:
> > Oct2001moms-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
> >
> > ~~~ Don't forget! If you change the topic, change the subject line! ~~~
> >
>
> You would be able to add to the footer in the group settings page.
>

From the bottom of ALL our posts.

If you have questions, concerns or problems with this list, please email the
moderator, Joyce Fetteroll (fetteroll@... ) or the list owner,
Helen Hegener (HEM-Editor@...).

To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

Visit the Unschooling website: http://www.unschooling.com
